Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: Download counters not updating for pre-release packages?" (#8979) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Describe the bug

## TL/DR

It seems to me that the download counter is not working for versions of packages that are marked as pre-release.

The total download for a package that has pre-release versions but also "normal" versions seems to work fine, even though each pre-release version is stuck at 0 (zero).

Please note that the usual delay of 24/48h for the stats to be updated is already passed, since we are at around 6 days.
Also, in these 6 days the other downloads seem to have been updated just fine: I'm talking about my **global** downloads, the downloads for each **package as a whole**, and the downloads for each **package version** that is NOT a pre-release version.


## The setup

Up until last week I had 3 packages on nuget.org , all of them had some versions released in the last year, and none of those versions were pre-release (per semantic versioning).

All was fine.

Last week (Jan 27th to be precise) I uploaded 2 completely new packages (both with a pre-release version) and 3 new versions (again, all pre-release) of the 3 existing packages.
So all of these were in "alpha1" version.
Then about 3 days after that i pushed another pre-release version ("alpha2") for all of the 5 packages.

You can see all 5 of them [here](https://www.nuget.org/profiles/jodydonetti) (screenshot taken 2022-02-02):

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1010086/152252639-1d57cb56-60c9-4d44-8e71-c5548df49e88.png)

(Now don't be fooled by the 0.1.9 you can see as the "Latest version" for the first 3 packages, since what is shown is the latest non-pre-release version, as I'm sure you know)

So, all these packages have an actual last version that is pre-release (currently "alpha2").


## The Problem

The problem is that since then, the download counters for each pre-releae version remained stuck at 0 (zero), even though me and other people already downloaded them.

See screenshots below for some evidence.

### Repro Steps

Hypothetically:
- upload a new pre-release version of an existing package OR upload a completely new package (with a pre-release version)
- make some downloads
- wait a couple of days
- download stats will not increase

### Expected Behavior

Download stats SHOULD increase.

### Screenshots

## New package

Downloads for one of the new packages ([this](https://www.nuget.org/packages/ZiggyCreatures.FusionCache.Backplane.StackExchangeRedis/0.1.0-alpha2)) after 6 days:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1010086/152254941-84a73ae1-4146-495c-8c6a-8de0828ef696.png)

## Existing package

Downloads for one of the existing packages ([this](https://www.nuget.org/packages/ZiggyCreatures.FusionCache/0.1.9)) after 6 days:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1010086/152255046-23f4fcda-e4cc-4c13-957e-a64710c3129f.png)

Note that as, I said above, in the last 6 days the downloads for the v0.1.9 kept increasing.

### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Feature]: Enhance the NuGetGallery backfill tools to allow a specific set of packages to be reprocessed" (#8961) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Related Problem

Current the backfill tool only allows the full DB to be reprocess via a "collect" command then an "update" command.


### The Elevator Pitch

Let's add a way to provide a big list of package IDs and versions to reprocess. These IDs and versions can be sourced from NuGet.Insights or Gallery DB depending on the situation. 

### Additional Context and Details

It looks like we may have some data issues in the package compatible frameworks data. This will allow us to fix bugs and reprocess select packages which is much faster than a full backfill.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[ReleasePrep][2022.02.09] RI of dev into main" (#8998) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened pull request "[ReleasePrep][2022.02.09] FI of main into dev" (#8997) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Merged pull request "[TFM Display][Bug] Any framework fix as supported framework." (#8996) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
* TFM data now allows a package that contains `any` framework to collect all their asset frameworks and store them in DB.
* `PackageFrameworkCompatibilityFactory` filters `any` framework, this won't show on the package details page.
* `BackfillTfmMetadataCommand` now supports adding `any` as a supported framework.

Addresses https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/4219.

Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue "Allow to user to input custom (floating) versions through the PM UI" (#9829) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: Change version input to a Combo Box displaying available version depending on the user input. This will allow users to select a floating version to install.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Warn about package source mapping section without pattern rules" (#11585) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Recently we got feedback on how to enable `packageSourceMapping`. Currently just having it `nuget.config` doesn't actually do anything, restore happens without any pattern rules.

For example:
```
  <packageSourceMapping> 
  </packageSourceMapping>
```

Above scenario implicitly happen nuget.config in child folder even though parent `nuget.config` had valid rules.
```
  <packageSourceMapping> 
      <clear />
  </packageSourceMapping>
```

Even below on does nothing since there is no pattern yet:
```
  <packageSourceMapping> 
    <packageSource key="nuget">
    </packageSource>
  </packageSourceMapping>
```

Below one does enable package source mapping rules.
```
  <packageSourceMapping> 
    <packageSource key="nuget">
        <package pattern="system.*" />
    </packageSource>
  </packageSourceMapping>
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Add progress reporting during package installation" (#11432) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Follow up to: https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/9782

In order to keep the changes manageable, the progress reporting for package installation/uninstallation/updates will be added separately.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Feature]: Provide details that explain why there was an auth related failure for a particular feed" (#11582) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product(s) Involved

Visual Studio Package Management UI

### The Elevator Pitch

On cases where the auth requests fails (silently before invoking auth prompts or after a new auth prompt fails), we should provide users context on why access to a feed failed and/or why creds were needed. 

The information could be displayed in the output or error pane and should provide enough data to help users assess how to manage their feeds and/or Visual Studio accounts.

### Additional Context and Details

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[DCR]: Provide context as part of the prompt that asks users to enter their credentials" (#11581) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product(s) Affected

Visual Studio Package Management UI

### Current Behavior

NuGet related auth prompts inside Visual Studio do not identify themselves as such and leave users wondering why Visual Studio is "randomly" asking for their credentials.

### Desired Behavior

Calls to show NuGet related auth prompts should identify themselves as coming from NuGet and surface that information to users in a discoverable manner.

### Additional Context

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[DCR]: Minimize the number of "retry auth prompts" to no more than one per feed" (#11580) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product(s) Affected

Visual Studio Package Management UI

### Current Behavior

Based on our discussions, each feed that fails to authenticate seems to prompt for creds up-to four times. 

If you have failures across multiple feeds, the addition of all these prompts results in the appearance of an infinite auth loop.

### Desired Behavior

The ask is to modify the current behavior to only ask one additional time per feed rather than 4 times

### Additional Context

_No response_
